attributes.action: investigate why it would not be a fairer system to transfer the vehicle road tax onto the price of fuel
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If Vehicle road tax revenues were put onto the cost of fuel then every motorist would pay for the mileage they actually drive. 
There would be incentives to buy & drive fuel efficient vehicles & no requirement for the expensive, complicated and intrusive electronic surveillance systems being proposed for road pricing / tolls. 
The calculation of how much to add per litre of fuel in order to raise the reveue required can be made on the basis of the records & revenue receipts from the fuel Companies on how much fuel was sold in the UK. 
Allowances can be made for LPG & diesel fuels, for commercial & farm vehicles, the poss' decreased in car use, & the additional amount raised from previously untaxed cars & from foreign drivers paying a charge on the fuel they bring in to the UK, etc.
Savings could be made at the DVLA & allow the Police able to concentrate on their other duties.

rejection.details:
There are several petitions on this area already. Please consider signing one of those, rather than setting up your own.
